div.head: To his ingenious Brother M RICH. BROME, vpon this witty issue of his Brayne, the Northern Lasse.
div.l: ALthough I call you by a Brothers name,
I must confesse (nor doe I feare the shame)
I am in loue with your faire Daughter, this,
As faire condition'd as her Father is.
Well met abroud, blithe, bonny, Northern Lasse:
Thy naturall Beauties, others farre surpasse
That are enrich'd with Fucusses of Art,
Thy witty sweetnesse beares so faire a part.
Not a Good woman, nor a Girle worth Gold,
Nor twenty such (whose gaudy shewes take hold
Of gazing eyes) shall in acceptance thriue
With thee, whose quaintnesse is superlatiue.
Dick may be proud shee's Daughter to no other;
As I am proud that I haue such a Brother.
